intro: Buglossoides goulandrisiorum subsp. thessalica, commonly known as the Greek bugloss, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe, particularly Greece. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its blue or violet flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid conditions. It has hairy leaves and a compact growth habit, making it a distinctive feature in its native landscape. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
